alert.note: Alert for Boulder And Jefferson Counties Below 6000 Feet, West Broomfield County; North Douglas County Below 6000 Feet, Denver, West Adams and Arapahoe Counties, East Broomfield County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued May 21 at 2:43AM MDT until May 21 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: .Snow will continue to slowly decrease from north to south across the region this morning. Light snow will linger across the Front Range urban corridor with bands of moderate to heavy snow showers primarily over the Palmer Divide. Snow accumulation on trees this morning will cause some tree limbs to break and produce scattered power outages. Do not park under trees and avoid walking under snow laden trees. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MDT TODAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Snow ongoing. Additional snow accumulations less than two inches. * WHERE...Boulder and the western suburbs of Denver, and Denver. * WHEN...Until Noon MDT today. * IMPACTS...Snow accumulation tree branches and powerlines, may lead to power outages. Do not walk under snow laden trees.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for Colorado can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by going to www.cotrip.org.
